methods.name: Focus
methods.description: Sets focus on the widget element, if it can be focused and keyboardOperation=true

methods.name: Reload
methods.description: Reloads the configured src/url of the widget.

methods.name: setAdditionalStyle
methods.description:
Add an additional style to the widget element. The initial style will not be removed.
The additional style will not be removed, when the style of the widget is changed.
You can remove the additional style via removeAdditionalStyle.

methods.name: setEditable
methods.description:
Sets the state of property «editable»
Used for «editable» binding; method is called exclusevely by the framework

methods.name: SetHost
methods.description: Sets the host, as in hostname or ip-address.

methods.name: setParentCoWiId
methods.description: Used to inherit parentCoWiId inside of compound widgets to inner widgets which are not projected, e.g. inner widgets of Login widget

methods.name: SetUseURL
methods.description: Sets the value of the option for selecting the source displayed in the widget.

events.name: DisabledClick
events.description: Fired when disabled element is clicked on.

parameter.name: origin
parameter.description: id of widget that triggered this event

parameter.name: hasPermission
parameter.description: defines if the state is caused due to missing roles of the current user

parameter.name: horizontalPos
parameter.description: horizontal position of click in pixel i.e '10px'

parameter.name: verticalPos
parameter.description: vertical position of click in pixel i.e '10px'

events.name: EnableChanged
events.description: Fired when operability of the widget changes.

events.name: FocusIn
events.description: Fired when the widgets gets focus

events.name: FocusOut
events.description: Fired when the widgets lost focus

events.name: VisibleChanged
events.description: Fired when the visibility of the widget changes.

properties.name: busy
properties.description: Request not yet completed.

properties.name: enable
properties.description: Initial option to enable widget.

properties.name: host
properties.description:
Hostname or IP of the server the data is to be pulled from. If this is
left blank this field will default to value of the source of where the
application is running.

 Common explanation of host, port, path and query:

 Property specification of the URL. URL is the Uniform Resource Locator
 where the webpage's address is given. It is written on the format of:

 http://[host][:port][/path][?query]

 an example to break down the B&R homepage URL as following to add
 to the properties:

https://www.br-automation.com/en/search/?stype=0&key=mapp%20View

explanation:
 -here the host is: www.br-automation.com
 -the port is by default 80, and can thus be left at default.
 -the path is: /en/search/
 -the query is: stype=0&key=mapp%20View

properties.name: path
properties.description:
The path of the URL, this is what comes after the port (if given) or after
the domain. E.g.: in the url www.example.com/this/is/the/path/
The path field would have to be 'this/is/the/path/'

properties.name: permissionOperate
properties.description: restricts operability to users, which have given roles

properties.name: permissionView
properties.description: restricts visibility to users, which have given roles

properties.name: port
properties.description: Port of the server, default value is 80.

properties.name: query
properties.description:
The query of a URL is the parameters after the & , also known as the
GET-parameters. These should be specified as following:

single parameter: param=value
multiple parameters: param1=value&param2=value&param3=value

properties.name: src
properties.description:
Here the url from the browser can be copied and pasted into, and the
webpage will be displayed.

The src can be used to specify the entire URL at once on the format:

http://[host][:port][/path][?query]

E.g.: https://www.br-automation.com/en/search/?stype=0&key=mapp%20View

Port 80 is standard for the web and thus doesn't have to be added.

properties.name: style
properties.description: reference to a style for this widget type

properties.name: tabIndex
properties.description:
sets if a widget should have autofocus enabled (0), the order of the focus (>0),
or if autofocus should be disabled (-1)

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: reference to a tooltip for a widget

properties.name: useURL
properties.description:
This option toggles between using the Properties (host, port, path AND
query) and the src-property. If true the four properties together will
be used to create the url, else the src-option will be used.

By default, the URL-properties are used and if not altered these will
direct the user to the SDM of the source.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: change visibility

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description: maximum outer height of widget

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: minimum outer height of widget

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: maximum outer width of widget

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: minimum outer width of widget

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description:
The zIndex property specifies the z-order of a widget and its childs.
When widgets overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other. A widget with a larger zIndex generally covers a widget with a lower one.
The zIndex must be unique within a content.

properties.name: left
properties.description: absolute position measured from left boundary of parent container

properties.name: top
properties.description: absolute position measured from top boundary of parent container

properties.name: height
properties.description: outer height of widget

properties.name: width
properties.description: outer width of widget

descriptions.de: Zeigt HTML Seiten an, die von einer externen Quelle kommen
descriptions.en: Displays HTML pages coming from an external source

Description: absolute position measured from top boundary of parent container
absolute position measured from left boundary of parent container

The zIndex property specifies the z-order of a widget and its childs.
When widgets overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other. A widget with a larger zIndex generally covers a widget with a lower one.
The zIndex must be unique within a content.
Sets the widget's border color, and may have one to four values (starting with the top border, clockwise direction).
Sets the border style of the widget. Options are 'none', solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'double', and 'groove'.

Sets the widget's border width, and may have one to four values (starting with the top border, in the clockwise direction).
        Examples: '2px' (all borders set to this value), '2px 10px 2px 2px' (all but right border set to 2px)
Sets the corner radius of the widget's border, and may contain one to four values (starting with the top left corner, in the clockwise direction).
outer height and width of widget
